intro: Hepetis spectabilis, commonly known as the showy heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodlands and swampy areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense whorls. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
